alert.note: Alert for Bee; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 12:48AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Live Oak and northwestern Bee Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1248 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout over Karon, or 9 miles east of Three Rivers, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mineral, Oakville, Ray Point, Karon and Pettus. This includes Interstate 37 between mile markers 62 and 70. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
